body: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/TrctbQV3*PshbM7*K*Rv2XtVNanUPICbHt0a1GAD-jAqL4DNLam3mM14QMAMbd3JGvSsgPliA3sQLFlhEgERrC0XBxTblFKU/Radiation.JPG)[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/TrctbQV3*PscMhmUBjM8pkVxrANNxHCu5h7NmMUTWyQarBbyGyWHEgMLMBK4F2kIfA4Uhr67IHlfOM1AHfb1wbQ7MkjTxVE-/Radiation.JPG)The annual radiation values for the Sky Dome on surfaces close to vertical are very different from those on the Radiation Rose.  I'm not including any context so no geometry blocking the solar radiation.  I assume the results should correlate?  Thanks.[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/TrctbQV3*PtsvGJlDYJLGTx7DupDzYJlkxezSp49baBfOWwm5N*-2uH8-BrKDs-gUY0AG7OeXGZEVKDIvcZFyx88AJ0TO2DM/Radiation.JPG)
topic: Radiation Intensity Values for Radiation Rose and Sky Dome Don't Match

replies.body: Hi Chris, They should. Let me check this tomorrow and get back to you. For some reason I missed this discussion before the release.
Hi Mostapha I've found the same problem: was it corrected in the new release?

Ah! I missed this one because I didn't add it to github. If I remember right the reason for the issue is the wrong implementation of the north input. Sorry for not checking this Chris.

Mostapha



[https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/ladybug/issues/231](https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/ladybug/issues/231)
